Work as part of a devops team to establish a global data center management and deployment infrastructure that is extensible to both private and public clouds and can be leveraged across multiple data centers. This includes automating server and application deployments and upgrades, patching and upgrading of servers, and tool integration with our monitoring system and public cloud provider APIs.
Work as part of a devops team to establish a global data center management and deployment infrastructure that is extensible to both private and public clouds and can be leveraged across multiple data centers. This includes automating server and application deployments and upgrades, patching and upgrading of servers, and tool integration with our monitoring system and public cloud provider APIs. The team owns and maintains the tool stack, which includes OpenSource and commercial tools, as well as tools developed in-house.
Monitor and tune system stability, capacity and performance using a variety of OpenSource and commercial tools. Create and integrate custom monitors for specific application needs.
Help us move towards a software defined infrastructure model where all components, including networking and load balancing, are software defined and automated. Collaborate with other teams on complex troubleshooting issues Other duties as directed by management
Requirements:
– Strong scripting skills on Linux platforms. Scripting skills on Windows platform a plus.
– Ability to interact with REST services and consume public cloud provider APIs.
– Extensive experience working with configuration management systems such as Ansible, Chef, or Puppet. Strong background in Puppet highly desired.
– Extensive experience working in hybrid cloud environments including both private and public clouds. Experience with Amazon AWS highly desired.
– Experience with database technologies, such as MySQL, PostGres, Oracle, or Vertica.
– Experience with monitoring systems and monitoring concepts. Knowledge of Nagios, or AppDynamics a plus.
– Experience supporting a complex application stack including Vertica, Tomcat, Mule, and Apache.

משרדי Riskified
We are looking for a senior DevOps engineer who will be responsible for building and maintaining Riskified’ servers and taking the product to the next level. As a DevOps engineer you will analyze the company’s services and processes in order to improve the overall availability, scalability, and reliability of its services.
The position is an integral part of the Development team, and plays a key role in product planning and execution.
 Responsibilities:
– Automate all operational processes
– Continuously improve Riskified’s visibility into its systems and applications with advanced monitoring, metrics, and log analytics
– Identify root causes of critical problems throughout the platform, and take necessary steps to resolve them
– Build and deploy tools to ensure the health and reliability of the Riskified platform
– Help build our product release workflow and continuous delivery system
– Manage the underlying infrastructure on AWS. Design, build, and manage our next-generation infrastructure
– Create and maintain internal configuration and deployment
– Understand, implement, and automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation
– Oversee Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment
Requirements:
– At least 6-7 years prior experience as DevOps Engineer
– Strong background in Linux administration
– Experience working with configuration management such as Chef, Puppet, or Ansible
– Proficiency with at least one scripting/programming language, preferably Ruby, Python, or JS
– Experience with Build/Deploy/Continuous Integration tools such as Jenkins or GoCD
– Extensive experience working with cloud platforms (preferably AWS) including cloud formation, VPC, etc.
– Proficient with monitoring tools
– Operational experience working with databases (PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch) – an advantage
– Experience in docker container technology
– Ability to prioritize tasks and work independently

משרדי Webpals
A company working in the Internet Marketing realm, mainly in online gaming, we are looking for a strong and ambitious Full-Stack developer, experienced and passionate with web development.
You will be part of a team develop software solutions with wide range of technologies: from BigData high performance systems to web systems, and tailor made tools. We look for the Web Ninja that keep study new technologies, that believe in choosing the right tool and development language to get the job done.
We work in scrum, and have cool and friendly web ninjas with 10~ years of experience that will assist you to bootstrap your knowledge and to feel part of a great and bright team.
Responsibilities:
– Analyze requirements and specifications from product manager & development manager.
– Design and implement technical solutions with emphasis on quality and performance, from architecture and technology selection to a full implementation and production support.
– Build new systems and features, heavily based on AWS.
– Develop in web technologies, server-side (70%) and client-side (30%).
– Develop a testable code, with unit tests and QA Automation in mind.
– Maintain code, troubleshoot & solve issues in live sites and systems.
– Work in SCRUM teams that encourage collaboration and face to face communication.
Requirements:
– Strong Full-stack developer with get things done approach.
– Endless curiosity about how things work, especially the web.
– Strong database knowledge (SQL, NoSQL).
– Familiarity with AWS (RDS, DynamoDb, lambda)
– Experience with Git source control branch strategies and repository management.
– At least 3 years’ experience in one or more of PHP \ Python \ node.js
– At least 2 years of hands-on experience in SQL, HTML5, JavaScript, JQuery, CSS, XML, Ajax, JSON
– Experience in node.js & AWS – Major advantage
– Experience in Angular.js – Major Advantage
– Experience working with Linux environment
– Link to github page – a huge Advantage!
